shorts.title: Lackawanna County contract with SEIU to save $1.2M in health care costs
shorts.title_distilled: Lackawanna County contract with SEIU to save $1.
shorts.description: The Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.2 million in health care costs

shorts.title: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to Board of Directors
shorts.title_distilled: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A.
shorts.description: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.
shorts.content: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.

shorts.title: Post 7069 donates to police and fire departments
shorts.title_distilled: Post 7069 donates to police and fire departments.
shorts.description: VFW Abington Memorial Post 7069, Clarks Summit, donated $500 each to the Clarks Summit Police Department and Clarks Summit Fire Department No. 1, to be used as needed. From left: Geri Carey, Clarks Summit Borough Council president; Michael McLane, Post 7069 quartermaster/adjutant; Police Chief Chris Yarns; Fire Chief Joe Krott; Donald Jones, Post 7069 commander; and Harry Kelly, Clarks Summit mayor.
shorts.content: VFW Abington Memorial Post 7069, Clarks Summit, donated $500 each to the Clarks Summit Police Department and Clarks Summit Fire Department No. 1, to be used as needed. From left: Geri Carey, Clarks Summit Borough Council president; Michael McLane, Post 7069 quartermaster/adjutant; Police Chief Chris Yarns; Fire Chief Joe Krott; Donald Jones, Post 7069 commander; and Harry Kelly, Clarks Summit mayor.

shorts.title: HS BASKETBALL: Two new teams rise to No. 1 in polls
shorts.title_distilled: HS BASKETBALL: Two new teams rise to No.
shorts.description: After an exciting week of play in the Lackawanna League, there are two new teams at the top of The Times-Tribune High School Basketball Polls. High-scoring Dunmore (13-1) is at No. 1 in the boys ranking, while North Pocono (11-3) returns to the No. 1 slot in the girls poll as teams in Division I keep knocking each other off in head-to-head games. Dunmore defeated rival Holy Cross and Honesdale in a game where it scored a season-high 97 points to earn a unanimous selection at No. 1. The Bucks have another challenge in Division II to finish the first […]
shorts.content: After an exciting week of play in the Lackawanna League, there are two new teams at the top of The Times-Tribune High School Basketball Polls. High-scoring Dunmore (13-1) is at No. 1 in the boys ranking, while North Pocono (11-3) returns to the No. 1 slot in the girls poll as teams in Division I keep knocking each other off in head-to-head games. Dunmore defeated rival Holy Cross and Honesdale in a game where it scored a season-high 97 points to earn a unanimous selection at No. 1. The Bucks have another challenge in Division II to finish the first […]
shorts.content_distilled: After an exciting week of play in the Lackawanna League, there are two new teams at the top of The Times-Tribune High School Basketball Polls.

shorts.title: NEPA kicks off America250PA celebrations
shorts.description: WILKES-BARRE, LUZERNE COUNTY (WBRE/WYOU) — The kickoff to America's 250th anniversary has begun with festivities finding their way to northeastern Pennsylvania on Sunday. A few were held locally, including one Sunday evening at the Luzerne County Courthouse. Dozens of people attended the event to help commemorate Pennsylvania's contributions to the nation. America250PA is making its [...]
shorts.content: WILKES-BARRE, LUZERNE COUNTY (WBRE/WYOU) — The kickoff to America's 250th anniversary has begun with festivities finding their way to northeastern Pennsylvania on Sunday. A few were held locally, including one Sunday evening at the Luzerne County Courthouse. Dozens of people attended the event to help commemorate Pennsylvania's contributions to the nation.
